entry.title: Mexico wins 7th Gold Cup title with 3-1 victory over Jamaica
entry.summary: Mexico's Jesus Duenas celebrates after a goal by teammate Jesus Corona during the second half of the CONCACAF Gold Cup championship soccer match against Jamaica, Sunday, July 26, 2015, in Philadelphia.

entry.title: Mexico wins 7th Gold Cup title with 3-1 victory over Jamaica (Yahoo Sports)
entry.summary: Mexico, which already held the record for most Gold Cup titles, is 7-1 in finals.

entry.title: Mexico wins 7th Gold Cup title with 3-1 victory over Jamaica
Mexico wins 7th Gold Cup title with victory over Jamaica
entry.summary: Jamaica hadn't trailed since early in the second half of its Gold Cup opener before a yellow card helped lead to Mexico's first goal.

entry.title: Mexico tops Jamaica in Gold Cup final
entry.summary:
Mexico had gone 272 minutes since one of its players scored on anything other than a penalty when Guardado put El Tri ahead for good Sunday.

Guardado, voted top player of the tournament, had also been the last Mexico player to score on anything other than a penalty with his goal in the 88th minute against Trinidad and Tobago in the final group stage match.

entry.title: Mexico uncovers 60 graves with 129 bodies
entry.summary: More than 20,000 people are listed as missing across Mexico, and there are many "disappeared" in Guerrero, a state that is a major opium producer and the battleground among several cartels warring over territory and drug smuggling routes.

entry.title: Mexico search for missing students turns up 129 bodies
entry.summary: The search for 43 missing college students in the southern state of Guerrero has turned up at least 60 clandestine graves and 129 bodies over the last 10 months, Mexico's attorney general's office says.

entry.title: Mexico police bust greenhouses with genetically modified pot
entry.summary:
Federal authorities in Mexico say they arrested 22 Colombians and three Mexicans using greenhouses to grow genetically modified and cloned marijuana.

The statement says the Colombians said they had been contacted by emails offering them jobs in the Mexico and they ended up at the site in the municipality of Tlajomulco de Zunia.

entry.title: Mexico police bust greenhouses with genetically modified pot

entry.summary: On Sunday, a few hundred people led by parents of the missing youths marched in Mexico City to call for justice in the case.

entry.summary: The next, he was explaining why Jamaica will be going after the victory against Mexico on Sunday.

entry.title: Verizon workers vote to authorize strike, if necessary
entry.summary:
PHILADELPHIA (AP) " Mexico is the favorite to win its record-extending seventh CONCACAF Gold Cup title, and coach Miguel Herrera is answering questions about his future with the team.

Indeed, Mexico did outplay Costa Rica in the quarterfinals, though that game was moments from going to penalty kicks until El Tri benefited from another questionable call in the last minute of extra time.

The only way Mexico has been able to score during the knockout rounds is on penalty kicks.

entry.title: On A Visit To Kenya, Obama Addresses Fight Against Extremists
Lightning strike kills 7, including 4 children, in Mexico
Mexico human rights commission: Investigation into 43 missing rife with errors, omissions
entry.summary: MEXICO CITY - Mexico's human rights commission says the government's investigation into the fate of 43 missing college students is marked by failures and omissions in its procedures.

entry.title: At Mexico's narco cemetery, graves await the inevitable

New Mexico police chief wants 1971 fugitive in Cuba returned
entry.summary:
The New Mexico State Police chief says he would personally pay for a return ticket for a fugitive living in Cuba wanted in the killing of a New Mexico police officer.

Hill fled to the communist island after authorities say he killed state police officer Robert Rosenbloom in New Mexico in 1971.

Responding to President Barack Obama's move to thaw relations with Cuba, New Mexico Gov. Susana Martinez in December renewed a request that the Obama administration try to extradite Hill, who is now 65 years old.

entry.title: New Mexico Police Chief Wants 1971 Fugitive in Cuba Returned
New Mexico Democratic lawmaker to stay on LULAC board
entry.summary: A New Mexico Democratic lawmaker says she will not resign from the board of the nation's oldest Latino civil rights group despite calls to step down.

entry.title: US ponders a shocking loss; Mexico advances with ugly win
entry.summary:
That will go to either Mexico or Jamaica, who meet in Sunday's final at Philadelphia.

Mexico rallied for a 2-1 victory over Panama on two late penalty kicks by Andres Guardado " one in stoppage time, the other in extra time.

Mexico won it after Geiger awarded another kick for Harold Cummings' takedown of Javier Orozco in the penalty area, setting up Guardado's winning goal in the 105th.

entry.title: US Ponders a Shocking Loss; Mexico Advances With Ugly Win
Mexico Reaches Gold Cup Final After Heated Win Over Panama
entry.summary:
There was tension from both teams as Mexico players pushed Panama's players away from Rodriguez, who remained on the ground.

Finally, Tejada departed into the tunnel, leaving Panama with the difficult task of taking on Mexico with 10 players.

entry.title: Guardado lifts Mexico past angry Panama, 2-1, in Gold Cup
entry.summary: A win by Panama's win would have been an upset, but not on the level of Jamaica's shocker over the U.S. Mexico is No.

entry.title: Guardado lifts Mexico past angry Panama, 2-1, in Gold Cup
entry.summary: Panama played at a disadvantage after forward Luis Tejada drew a red card and was ejected for his contact with Mexico's Francisco Rodriguez about 25 minutes into the match.

entry.title: Breaking Bad's Steven Michael Quezada runs for office in New Mexico
After escape, Mexico's strongest cartel boss faces radically altered drug-trafficking business
entry.summary: MEXICO CITY - Mexico's most powerful drug lord, Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman, has a lot to catch up on as he returns to a drug-trafficking landscape that has shifted considerably during his 17 months behind bars.

entry.title: After escape, Mexico cartel boss faces altered drug business
entry.summary:
Only the Jalisco New Generation, the big gun cartel that forced down the helicopter, has used the void to grow into one of Mexico's most powerful international criminal groups.

"The Jalisco cartel has been growing ... and Sinaloa was debilitated by the arrest of El Chapo," said Raul Benitez, a security expert with the National Autonomous University of Mexico.

entry.title: After Escape, Mexico Cartel Boss Faces Altered Drug Business
Mexico tops Costa Rica 1-0 in Gold Cup on late penalty
entry.summary: Mexico won 1-0 on Sunday night in the CONCACAF Gold Cup quarterfinals on Andres Guardado's penalty kick in the final minute of extra time.

entry.title: Mexico tops Costa Rica 1-0 in Gold Cup on late penalty
entry.summary:
Mexico had dominated play but was unable to score until the final moments.

Angry Costa Rica fans - heavily outnumbered by Mexico fans in the crowd of 74,187 at MetLife Stadium - threw bottles toward the field in protest.

The Mexico-Costa Rica matchup looked like a potential final at the start of the tournament, with Costa Rica coming off a World Cup quarterfinal appearance last year.

Mexico repeatedly broke down Costa Rica's defense to set up good looks only to miss high or wide.

entry.title: Panama, Mexico in CONCACAF Gold Cup semis
entry.summary: Guardado converted to send six-time champion Mexico to the semifinals, in which it will face Panama on Wednesday night in Atlanta.

entry.title: Most US-Mexico Border Smugglers Are U.S. Citizens, Paper Finds
Mexico City cabbies slam regulations on ride-sharing apps
entry.summary: MEXICO CITY (AP) " Representatives of Mexico City's regular cab drivers are criticizing new regulations published this week on ride-sharing apps such as Uber.

entry.title: U.S. asked for custody of Joaquin (El Chapo) Guzman: Mexico
entry.summary: Mexico had previously said it expected a request but had indicated in January that Guzman would not be handed over because he would serve time in his home country.

entry.title: Mexico: US requested drug lord's extradition before escape
Uber praises new Mexico City regulations allowing smartphone-based ride-sharing services
entry.summary: MEXICO CITY - The Uber ride-sharing app praised Mexico City's decision to become the first city in Latin America - and the largest in the world - to issue official regulations for such smartphone-based services.

entry.title: Uber praises new Mexico City regulations; cabbies grouse
entry.summary: Uber's spokesman for Mexico and Central America says the company doesn't mind paying 1.5 percent of the proceeds from each ride into a transport-improvement fund.

entry.title: Ranchers sue over rule giving feds authority on state water
entry.summary: Ranchers in New Mexico, California and Washington state are challenging a new Obama administration rule giving federal agencies authority to protect some streams and wetlands.

entry.title: Mexico draws in frenetic finish, gets Costa Rica in quarterfinal
entry.summary: Trinidad and Tobago (2-0-1, 7 points) took Group C's top seed into the quarterfinals, and will face Panama on Sunday in East Rutherford, N.J. Mexico (1-0-2, 5 points) will play Costa Rica in the second game Sunday.

entry.title: Mexico launches nationwide search for escaped drug lord 'El Chapo' Guzman
entry.summary: Mexico's government on Tuesday broadcast security camera footage of Guzman in the final moments before he escaped from the maximum security prison.

entry.title: Mexico, Trinidad and Tobago draw in Gold Cup
entry.summary: "We had an objective to get to the quarterfinals. We wanted to win the first game and get the result from Cuba (a 2-0 win on July 12), and not have to play Mexico to get to the quarterfinals."

entry.title: Mexico, Trinidad and Tobago draw in Gold Cup
entry.summary:
Two goals in stoppage time led to a 4-4 draw between Mexico and Trinidad and Tobago on Wednesday night in their final group match at the CONCACAF Gold Cup.

Tied 3-3 through regulation, Mexico pulled ahead on an own goal by Trinidad and Tobago defender Cordell Cato in the first minute of extra play.

entry.title: Mexico searches nationwide for escaped drug lord
Mexico City sets rules allowing Uber, other ride-share apps
entry.summary: In a statement, Uber commended the regulations issued Wednesday and said Mexico City was the largest in the world to take such a step.

entry.title: Mexico City publishes regulations allowing Uber and other smartphone-based ride-sharing apps
Mexico City Sets Rules Allowing Uber, Other Ride-Share Apps
Mexico's first auction of oil sites draws few bids
entry.summary: MEXICO CITY (AP) " Mexico is getting off to a rough start in its effort to attract investment for its oil fields by allowing private companies to enter the energy sector after a seven-decade state monopoly.

entry.title: Mexico opens oil sector to private companies with first auction, but draws few bids
entry.summary:
Only two of 14 exploration and production blocks in the Gulf of Mexico put up for auction Wednesday attracted bids, and the auction did not attract the world's biggest oil companies.

Until last year's legislative overhaul, Mexico's oil sector had been closed to private companies since nationalization in 1938.

entry.title: Mexico's First Auction of Oil Sites Draws Few Bids
Mexico drug lord escape tunnel is audacious engineering feat
entry.summary: ALMOLOYA, Mexico (AP) - Mexico's most prized prisoner paced his cell, first to the latrine, then the shower, then the bed.

entry.title: Mexico drug lord escape tunnel is audacious engineering feat
entry.summary: Seven more strides and the man who Mexico's government said could not possibly repeat his 2001 prison escape stepped through a sliding steel door into the chilly night on a high plain west of the capital.

entry.title: The moment Mexico’s drug lord escaped
entry.summary:
If anyone was capable of pulling off such a feat, it was Guzman, who is believed to have at least a quarter-century of experience in building large, sophisticated tunnels to smuggle drugs under the US-Mexico border and to escape from hideouts as authorities closed in.

"By far they are the most infiltrated in Mexico's government institutions," he said.

He said the tunnel at Altiplano was longer than any passage ever found on the US-Mexico border.

entry.title: Mexico Prison Boss Sacked After El Chapo Escape
Mexico offers $3.8M reward for 'El Chapo'
Mexican drug lord's escape tunnel was deep and 'high-tech'
entry.summary:
The kind of tunnel that led Mexico's most powerful drug lord to freedom would have been more than a year in planning.

The entrance would have to be in a place beyond the view of security cameras at Mexico's toughest prison.

As authorities hunted Monday for any sign of Mexico's most powerful drug lord, it was clear that Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman's escape must have involved inside help on a grand scale.

entry.title: U.S. agents knew of, alerted Mexico to 2014 ‘El Chapo’ escape plots: DEA documents
entry.summary: The internal DEA documents reveal that drug agents first got information on escape plans in March 2014, about a month after Guzman was captured in the seaside resort town of Mazatlan, Mexico.

entry.title: White House: US offers full support to Mexico to bring drug lord 'El Chapo' Guzman to justice
entry.summary: The White House says U.S. Attorney General Loretta Lynch spoke with Mexico's attorney general on Sunday.

entry.title: US offers full support to Mexico to capture drug lord
entry.summary:
WASHINGTON (AP) - The United States is pledging assistance to Mexico's government in bringing escaped drug kingpin Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman to justice.

White House spokesman Josh Earnest says the U.S. government is offering its full support to Mexico.

entry.title: Tropical Storm Dolores strengthens off coast of Mexico
Escape by top drug lord a strong blow to Mexico's government
Escape by top drug lord a strong blow to Mexico's government
entry.summary:
"All the accolades that Mexico has received in their counter-drug efforts will be erased by this one event" if Guzman is not recaptured, said Michael S. Vigil, a retired U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration chief of international operations.

According to a report from the Congressional Research Service in May, extraditions from Mexico to the U.S. peaked at 115 in 2012, the last year of Pena Nieto's predecessor, Felipe Calderon.

entry.title: Mexico finishes in a disappointing 0-0 tie with Guatemala
entry.summary: Mexico had two other near misses.

entry.title: Mexico kingpin 'Chapo' Guzman stages brazen jailbreak in blow to president
Canada's Abel, Mexico's Garcia win diving gold, earn Rio berth
entry.summary: Colombia's Victor Ortega (455.15) took the silver and Mexico's Jonathan Ruvalcabra (437.35) won bronze.

entry.title: Recent detentions of top alleged Mexico drug chiefs
entry.summary:
He was allegedly the financial operator for the New Generation Cartel of Jalisco, a former Sinaloa ally that has grown rapidly into one of Mexico's most powerful drug-trafficking organizations.

-July 15, 2013: Officials in northern Mexico arrest Miguel Angel Trevino Morales, alias "Z-40," alleged leader of the Zetas cartel.

entry.title: Mexico: Drug lord 'El Chapo' Guzman escapes through tunnel
entry.summary:
Mexican navy marines patrol near the maximum security prison Altiplano in Almoloya, west of Mexico City, Sunday, July 12, 2015.

Police inspect a vehicle as they search for escaped drug lord Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman, around the Almoloya de Juarez prison in Toluca, Mexico, Sunday, July 12, 2015.

entry.title: Thousands flock to New Mexico city for international market
Mexico: Drug lord 'El Chapo' Guzman escapes through tunnel
entry.summary:
FILE - In this Feb. 22, 2014 file photo, Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman is escorted to a helicopter in handcuffs by Mexican navy marines at a navy hanger in Mexico City.

Former Mexican Attorney General Jesus Murillo Karam told the AP earlier this year that the U.S. would get Guzman in "about 300 or 400 years" after he served time for all his crimes in Mexico.

entry.title: Mexico: Drug lord 'El Chapo' Guzman escapes through tunnel
entry.summary:
A manhunt began immediately late Saturday for the head of the powerful Sinaloa Cartel, which has an international reach and is believed to control most of the major crossing points for drugs at the U.S. border with Mexico.

Guzman is known for the elaborate tunnels his cartel has built underneath the Mexico-U.S. border to transport cocaine, methamphetamines and marijuana, with ventilation, lighting and even railcars to easily move products.

entry.title: Mexico's drug lord 'El Chapo' Guzman escapes through tunnel
entry.summary: Guzman faces multiple federal drug trafficking indictments in the U.S. as well as Mexico, and was on the U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration's most-wanted list.

entry.title: The Latest: Mexico drug lord 'El Chapo' Guzman escapes
entry.summary: Mexico's top security official says top drug lord Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman has escaped through a 1.5-kilometer (1 mile) tunnel that opened into the shower area of his cell.

entry.title: Mexico: Top drug lord Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman escapes
entry.summary:
The cartel has been heavily involved in the bloody drug war that has torn through parts of Mexico for the last decade, taking at least an estimated 100,000 lives.

Sinaloa is believed now to control most of the major crossing points for drugs at the U.S. border with Mexico.

Guzman was caught by authorities for the first time in Guatemala in 1993, extradited and sentenced to 20 years in prison in Mexico for murder and drug trafficking.

entry.title: Mexico: Top drug lord Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman escapes
entry.summary:
MEXICO CITY (AP) - Mexico's top drug lord Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman has escaped from a maximum security prison for the second time, security officials announced late Saturday.

Guzman, who headed the powerful Sinaloa Cartel, was last seen in the area of the showers in the Altiplano prison outside of Mexico City.

entry.title: 70 evacuated as Colima volcano spews ash in western Mexico
entry.summary: Ash and cinders spewed Saturday from the Colima Volcano in western Mexico, prompting authorities to close the airport in the state capital of Colima and order the evacuation of a half dozen hamlets on the flanks of the peak.

entry.title: Mexico: Top drug lord Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman escapes
Trump criticizes border policy as well as trade agenda
entry.summary:
"I respect Mexico greatly as a country. But the problem we have is their leaders are much sharper than ours, and they're killing us at the border and they're killing us on trade."

When he called for a wall along the U.S.-Mexico border, the audience in Las Vegas groaned.

entry.title: Mexico's Pacheco wins springboard gold, earns Rio berth
entry.summary: TORONTO (Reuters) - Mexico's Rommel Pacheco won the gold medal in men's 3m springboard at the Pan American Games on Saturday to earn an automatic qualifying spot for the 2016 Rio Olympics.

entry.title: 70 evacuated as Colima volcano spews ash in western Mexico
entry.summary: Clouds of ash fill the sky after an eruption by the Colima volcano, known as the Volcano of Fire, near the town of Comala, Mexico, Friday, July 10, 2015.

entry.title: New Mexico cities top others in US for export growth
entry.summary: Three New Mexico cities have been ranked among the top five metropolitan areas in the country with the most export growth, New Mexico Gov. Susan Martinez said.

entry.title: Ash and cinders prompt evacuation of village near Colima volcano in western Mexico
entry.summary: MEXICO CITY - Ash and cinders spewing from the Colima Volcano in western Mexico have prompted authorities to evacuate 19 people from a nearby village.

entry.title: Colima Volcano blasts ash, lava in western Mexico
entry.summary: MEXICO CITY (AP) " A volcano in western Mexico has erupted, spewing ash more than 4 miles (7 kilometers) into the air and sending lava down its flanks.

entry.title: Colima Volcano Blasts Ash, Lava in Western Mexico
Movie review: 'Cartel Land' goes deep inside vigilantes' fight on both sides of Mexico-U.S. drug war
entry.summary: Like the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, the hellish morass that is the drug war in Mexico has resulted in numerous documentaries, including such recent efforts as "Narco Cultura" and "Western."

entry.title: Julio Iglesias returns with album dedicated to Mexico
entry.summary:
NEW YORK-- Spanish singing legend Julio Iglesias has announced a new album of songs inspired by Mexico, scotching speculation that the 71-year-old is retiring.

Iglesias said he dedicated the album to Mexico's "outstanding composers who, generation after generation, filled our lives with love, nostalgia, memories and moments."

entry.title: T-Mobile US calling plans to cover Canada and Mexico
entry.summary: T-Mobile US Inc. said this will mean savings for customers who travel to Canada or Mexico or call people there frequently.

entry.title: T-Mobile US calling plans to cover Canada and Mexico
entry.summary:
"We're just making Canada and Mexico part of your home territory," says T-Mobile CEO John Legere said on a conference call.

Previously, T-Mobile charged 20 cents per minute for calls made while traveling in Canada and Mexico.

For calls from the U.S. to those countries, T-Mobile customers previously had to buy an add-on global calling plan or pay 49 cents per minute to call Canada and 69 cents to call Mexico.

For instance, AT&T Inc. sells packages of minutes good for calls made while traveling in Mexico and Canada.

entry.title: T-Mobile US calling plans to cover Canada and Mexico
entry.summary:
T-Mobile is now offering its U.S. customers the ability to talk, text and browse the Internet in Canada and Mexico without paying extra charges.

The company points to the large amount of travel done by its U.S. customers in Canada and Mexico, saying that wireless carriers rake in billions of dollars in roaming charges as a result.

T-Mobile US Inc. and other wireless phones do work in Canada in Mexico, but carriers often tack on hefty roaming charges.

entry.title: Boy Scout killed in flooding at New Mexico ranch
entry.summary:
A Boy Scout was killed when a flash flood triggered by heavy rains swept through a canyon on a New Mexico ranch where he was camping, authorities said on Sunday.

The boy was swept away in flood waters in the North Ponil Canyon, the New Mexico station said.

Some 20,000 Boy Scouts visit the 214-square-mile Philmont ranch in northern New Mexico annually for backpacking, camping and other programs, according to its website.

A spokesman for the New Mexico State Police could not immediately be reached for comment.

entry.title: New Mexico working to modernize voting system
entry.summary: New Mexico is embarking on the final phase of an effort to modernize the state's election management and voter registration system, but officials say some changes won't be fully implemented until after the 2016 general election.

entry.title: Donald Trump says some of his comments about Mexico distorted
entry.summary:
After days of outrage, Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump said on Monday that some of his criticism of Mexico has been distorted but stuck to his stance that many illegal immigrants coming across the Mexican border are criminals.

Trump said the recent killing of a woman in San Francisco by a illegal immigrant from Mexico with a criminal record proves him right.

entry.title: Donald Trump says some of his comments about Mexico distorted
entry.summary:
However, he said, the United States has become "a dumping ground for Mexico" with illegal border-crossers smuggling illicit drugs and carrying "tremendous infectious disease."

"This is merely one of thousands of similar incidents throughout the United States. In other words, the worst elements in Mexico are being pushed into the United States by the Mexican government," he said.

entry.title: Mexico rescues 12 Cubans from makeshift raft
entry.summary: MEXICO CITY (AP) - The Mexican Navy says it has rescued 12 Cuban men who were found aboard a makeshift raft off the coast of the Yucatan Peninsula.

entry.title: Police: Beltran Leyva Cartel Boss Arrested in Mexico City
entry.summary:
Martin Villegas Navarrete, 38, was captured without a shot being fired while celebrating his birthday in the Roma Norte district of Mexico's capital, Mexico's Federal Police said in its official twitter account.

He allegedly used warehouses in Mexico City's main wholesale market as cover for his drug trafficking activities.

entry.title: Police: Beltran Leyva cartel boss arrested in Mexico City
entry.summary:
With the takedown of the Beltran Leyva leadership, the cartel splintered into smaller gangs that operated in central and southern Mexico, including the states of Morelos and Guerrero south of Mexico City.

Authorities in Mexico say Villegas controlled the Guerrero-Morelos-Mexico City corridor.

entry.title: Mexico City proposes regulations for Uber
entry.summary: "Regulation that allows us to continue to provide service that is quality, safe and efficient," said Luis de Uriarte, Uber spokesman for Mexico and Central America.

entry.title: Mexico City proposes regulations for Uber
entry.summary: The Organized Taxi Drivers of Mexico City have pushed the city to regulate or ban Uber, saying it's unfair that its drivers avoid costly licensing and inspections that taxis must undergo to operate.

entry.title: 7-year-old wounded in firefight in Mexico dies
'Cartel Land' shows good and bad of vigilantes in Mexico, US
entry.summary: The film opens on July 2, 2015 in Mexico, a day later in New York and and later in other U.S. cities.

entry.title: 'Cartel Land' shows good and bad of vigilantes in Mexico, US
entry.summary: "The central question I'm trying to answer in this film is whether it's just for citizens to take the law into their own hands," Heineman said at a recent news conference in Mexico City.

entry.title: 'Cartel Land' shows good and bad of vigilantes in Mexico, US
entry.summary:
MEXICO CITY (AP) - The documentary "Cartel Land" opens with chilling night scenes of large-scale methamphetamine cooking in rural Mexico.

The film, with the Academy Award-winning director Kathryn Bigelow as executive producer, opens in Mexico on Thursday, in New York on Friday and later in other U.S. cities.

entry.title: NYC reviewing Trump contracts after remarks
entry.summary: During the event, Trump said immigrants from Mexico are "bringing drugs, they're bringing crime, they're rapists, and some, I assume, are good people."

entry.title: Mexico: 7 Police Charged With Torture in Army Slaying Case
entry.summary: Authorities in Mexico on Wednesday formally accused seven state police officers of torturing three women who survived a confrontation a year ago in which soldiers allegedly killed at least a dozen suspected gang members after they surrendered.

entry.title: Mexico: 7 police charged with torture in army slaying case
entry.summary:
Four of the police officers have been detained and a judge is expected to issue an arrest warrant for the other three, according to a statement from the Attorney General's Office in Mexico State, where the killings took place.

Three women who survived came forward to say that agents of the Mexico State prosecutor's office had tortured them to support the army's version.

Before Wednesday, no charges had been filed against any of the detectives or prosecutor's agents accused of trying to cover up the case, although the Mexico State prosecutor had said about 20 were under investigation.

entry.title: New Mexico governor denounces Trump's comments
entry.summary: Last year, she won re-election in blue-leaning New Mexico, the state with the largest number of Hispanic residents, by a wide margin.

entry.title: New Mexico governor denounces Trump's comments
entry.summary:
New Mexico Gov. Susana Martinez denounced GOP presidential hopeful Donald Trump's recent remarks about Mexican immigrants and called his comments "horrible."

In addition, Martinez has gone on a number of trade missions to Mexico and has been pushing for more infrastructure at the booming border town of Santa Teresa.

entry.title: 1 Year After Mexico Army Slayings, Calls for Justice Mount
entry.summary: None has been charged, although about 20 are under investigation, the Mexico State prosecutors' office said.

entry.title: 1 year after Mexico army slayings, calls for justice mount
entry.summary: One year after soldiers executed as many as 15 suspects at a grain warehouse in southern Mexico, many say justice has still not been done.

entry.title: Mexico won't send contestant to Miss Universe
entry.summary:
Jones was Miss Universe 1991 and runs the Mexico competition.

She lauded Mexico's media giant Televisa for deciding not to air the pageant in announcing that Mexico would not participate.

entry.title: Mexico won't send contestant to Miss Universe
entry.summary: MEXICO CITY (AP) - Mexico's national beauty pageant director confirms the country won't send a contestant to the Miss Universe contest because of insulting remarks by Donald Trump, an owner of the pageant.

entry.title: Escapees planned to go to Mexico
Mexico's Televisa drops Miss Universe after Trump remarks
entry.summary: MEXICO CITY (AP) - Mexican media giant Televisa says it will no longer broadcast the Miss Universe Pageant or engage any other communication project with Donald Trump.

entry.title: Prison Escapee David Sweat Says Plan Was to Go to Mexico
entry.summary: "The plan was to head to Mexico, which would have been aided by Joyce Mitchell's vehicle," Cuomo said.

entry.summary: "When Mitchell doesn't show up, the Mexico plan gets foiled, and they head north toward Canada."

entry.title: Mexico president leaves hospital after gallbladder surgery, says he's feeling 'very good'
entry.summary: MEXICO CITY - Mexican President Enrique Pena Nieto left the hospital on Sunday after undergoing surgery to remove his gallbladder.

entry.title: Mexico President Leaves Hospital After Gallbladder Surgery
Boy Scout dies in flash flood while camping in New Mexico
entry.summary:
The teen was one of eight Boy Scouts participating in a 12-day trek at the Philmont Scout Ranch when the flooding hit, New Mexico State Police spokesman Chad Pierce said.

"At Philmont we strive to provide a safe and inspiring setting for Scouts to experience the natural environment of northern New Mexico and seek to protect both Scouts and wildlife."

entry.title: Boy Scout dies in flash flood while camping in New Mexico
entry.summary: CIMARRON, N.M. (AP) - New Mexico State Police say a Boy Scout on a camping trip with his troop has died after he and three other teens were swept away in a flash flood.

entry.title: Donald Trump pinata all the rage in Mexico
entry.summary:
A pinata depicting US Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump hangs outside a workshop in Reynosa, Mexico.

On Thursday, Mr Trump said he has great respect for Mexico and loves Mexicans.

Mr Trump said last week on Twitter: "I like Mexico and love the spirit of the Mexican people."

"Oscars were a great night for Mexico & why not - they are ripping off the US more than almost any other nation," Mr Trump tweeted.
